abstract: Returns an array of key paths that represent the restorable attributes of the document.
overview:
## Return Value

An array of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSString] objects, each of which contains a key path to one of the document’s attributes.

## Discussion

You can use this method instead of, or in addition to, the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/encodeRestorableState(with:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/restoreState(with:)] methods to save and restore the state of your document. The key paths must refer to attributes that are [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Conceptual/DevPedia-CocoaCore/KeyValueCoding.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40008195-CH25] and [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Conceptual/DevPedia-CocoaCore/KVO.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40008195-CH16] compliant.

When changes are detected, the specified attributes are automatically written to disk with the rest of the app’s interface-related state. At launch time, the attributes are automatically restored to their previous values.

# restorableStateKeyPaths

**Type Property**

Returns an array of key paths that represent the restorable attributes of the document.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class var restorableStateKeyPaths: [String] { get }
```

## Return Value

An array of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSString] objects, each of which contains a key path to one of the document’s attributes.

## Discussion

You can use this method instead of, or in addition to, the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/encodeRestorableState(with:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/restoreState(with:)] methods to save and restore the state of your document. The key paths must refer to attributes that are [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Conceptual/DevPedia-CocoaCore/KeyValueCoding.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40008195-CH25] and [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Conceptual/DevPedia-CocoaCore/KVO.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40008195-CH16] compliant.

When changes are detected, the specified attributes are automatically written to disk with the rest of the app’s interface-related state. At launch time, the attributes are automatically restored to their previous values.

## Handling Window Restoration

- **allowedClasses(forRestorableStateKeyPath:)**: Returns the classes that support secure coding.
- **encodeRestorableState(with:)**: Saves the interface-related state of the document.
- **restoreState(with:)**: Restores the interface-related state of the document.
- **invalidateRestorableState()**: Marks the document’s interface-related state as dirty.
- **restoreWindow(withIdentifier:state:completionHandler:)**: Restores a window that was associated with a document, after that document is reopened.
